alert.note: Alert for Avery (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 09 at 12:06PM EST until January 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, south winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Avery County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Avoid being outside near trees. If caught outside, watch for falling debris or tree limbs. Remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm and avoid windows and overhanging trees. Use caution if you must drive. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of weather information for the latest updates. Additional details can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.
